name: Gitter
tagline: Gridding and quantification of pinned colonies
body:
### Installation
To begin using gitter download the R package and run the following in command line:

```
$ R CMD INSTALL gitter_1.0.tar.gz
```

or from an R shell
```
$ install.packages('gitter_1.0.tar.gz', repos=NULL)
```
### Getting started
To get started, load the gitter package:
```
$ install.packages('gitter_1.0.tar.gz', repos=NULL)
```

Process a single sample image:

```
# Read sample image path
f = system.file("data", "sample.jpg", package="gitter")
# Process it
dat = gitter(f)
# View head of the results
head(dat)

# Remember:
# output files by default are saved to your working directory
```

For further documentation on the parameters you can pass to gitter or how to process batch images try typing the following into your R console:

```
?gitter
?gitter.batch
```

For information on the package:
```
?Rgitter
```
### Authors and contributors
gitter was built by Omar Wagih and Leopold Parts at the Donnelly Centre for Cellular and Biomolecular Research, University of Toronto

### Citation
A lot of time and effort went into developing gitter. If you use it in your research, please cite:

### Support or Contact
Having trouble with gitter? Check out the documentation as mentioned above or contact us and weâ€™ll help you sort it out
